html:
Verb[edit]

iacuerātis

  1. second-person plural pluperfect active indicative of iaceō
    1. "you had lain prostrate, you had lain down; you had reclined"
    2. "you had lain ill, you had been sick"
    3. "you had lingered, you had tarried"
    4. "you had been placed or situated, you had lain"
    5. "you had been low, flat or level"
    6. "you had lain still"
    7. "you had lain dead"
    8. "you had lain in ruins"
    9. "you had hung down loose"
    10. (of the face or eyes) "you had been fixed on the ground, you had been cast down"
    11. "you had been indolent, idle or inactive"
    12. "you had lain dormant or abandoned, you had been of no avail"
    13. "you had lain overthrown; you had been refuted; you had been despised"
    14. (of speech or language) "you had been languid, dull or lifeless"
